intro: Giardia tarton-raira, commonly known as the golden spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. The plant produces a latex-like substance that is toxic and can cause skin irritation upon contact. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies of xerophytic vegetation.
